meta.Title: WITH HINTS FROM THE HEADLINES [New York Times, Sunday, November 29, 1942]
meta.Author: Willard N. Jordan

across.question: They helped open our newest front.
"Do they so want peace . . . that they've lost their ___?"—Page.
French river, tributary of the Seine
"No bandit ___, no tyrant mad with pride."—Pope.
Triangular-shaped stamp of Good Hope Colony.
Russian city in Black Earth area.
"Books can never teach the ___ of books."—Bacon.
Lower edge of a mine dump.
Body of men acting in advisory capacity.

down.question: Estonian river emptying into Gulf of Finland.
"The people must ___ some of their natural rights."—Jay.
British Secretary of State for India.
Henry VIII cut her dead in public.
Work now being done on Normandie.
"Guilt and misery . . . ___ privacy and solitude."—De Quincey.
Member of U. S. Supreme Court.
Rationed items keeping our mechanized forces rolling.
"The citizens are ___, and speak not a word."—Shakespeare.
Distance left in your old auto tires.
Old Roman tablet for posting lists.
"Men who had lost both ___ and heart."—Macaulay.
